title: Teen charged with attempted murder in Burlington shooting
content:
BURLINGTON CITY -- A Palymra youth was arrested Tuesday and charged in connection with a shooting that left another 17-year-old with a wounded leg last week, police said.
The shooting occurred Thursday in the 500 block of York Street around 7 p.m. A security officer was monitoring a surveillance camera when he observed a fight among several suspects. Police arrived and the victim, a Moorestown resident.
The suspect, who was arrested near the scene of the shooting, has been charged with attempted murder and weapons offenses. He was being held at the Burlington County Juvenile Detention Center in Pemberton.
The investigation is still active. Anyone with information is being asked to call Det. Anna Czajka 609-386-0262, ext. 221. Confidential tips can also be sent via a message to the department's Facebook page.
Paul Milo may be reached at pmilo@njadvancemedia.com. Follow him on Twitter@PaulMilo2. Find NJ.com on Facebook.
